alert.note: Alert for Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Northern El Paso County, Monument Ridge, Rampart Range Below 7500 Ft; Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Pikes Peak above 11000 Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued May 20 at 8:08AM MDT until May 21 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 PM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 18 inches over Teller and northern El Paso County, with the greatest amounts across eastern Teller and northwestern El Paso County. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches over southern El Paso County, with the greatest amounts across southwestern El Paso County closest to the higher terrain. * WHERE...Teller County and El Paso County. * WHEN...From noon Friday to 6 PM MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday evening commute. Heavy, wet snow could cause damage to trees and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Overnight lows will dip below freezing across El Paso county. Take precautions to protect tinder vegetation as well as exposed irrigation systems to prevent damage.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
